children.name: company
children.definition: an organization, that produces goods or provides services in order to make a profit:
examples: ▪ The company employs over 10,000 people worldwide.
oil/insurance/phone etc company
▪ It is the second largest insurance company in Germany.
work for a company
▪ My father used to work for one of the big oil companies.
join a companystart to work there
▪ Davis joined the company as vice-president of sales nine months ago.
set up/start a company
▪ The company was set up in 1975.
companynounBUSINESS
[ C ] an organization which sells goods or services in order to make money
_He works for a software company/a company that makes software.
_I work for Duggan and Company.
_No smoking is companypolicy.
Co./kəʊ/ the abbreviation of ‘Company’:
▪ Henry Butt and Co. Ltd
▪ Imperial Life Assurance Co. of Canada
Co.noun[ U ]BUSINESS
abbreviation forcompany (= business)
_Peters, Stynes & Co.

children.name: firm
children.definition: a company, especially one that providesservicesrather than producing goods, for example financial or legal services:
examples: công ty ( đặc biệt là cung cấp dịch vụ )
▪ Hanson decided to start his own management consulting firm.
law/electronics/building etc firm
▪ She works for a law firm in Amsterdam.
firm of lawyers/accountants etc
▪ Edward got a job with a firm of accountants in London.
join a firmstart working for a firm
▪ Harris joined the firm in 1992.
firmnoun[ C ]hãng;công ty
a company or business
_He works for a law firm called Neil and Vigliano.
_He's just started working for an accountancy firm/a firmofaccountants in Cambridge.

children.name: business
children.definition: a company that sells or produces goods or provides services, especially one that employs only asmall number of people or only one person:
examples: A2 [ C ] a particular company that buys and sells goods and services:
The two brothers established/set up/started up a clothes retailing business.
She runs her own printing business.
They put a lot of money into the family business.

children.name: công ty ( nhỏ , thường là cá nhân hay gia đình )
examples: ▪ Jack’s thinking of starting his own business.
▪ Several small businesses have folded closed in recent months.

children.name: manage/run a business
examples: ▪ Don and his wife run their own business.

children.name: set up/start a business
examples: ▪ Profits have slowly increased since we started the business three years ago.

children.name: small businessone that employs only one person or very few people
examples: ▪ His oldest daughter, 31, owns a small printing business in Fresno.

children.name: family businessone that was started by and employs members of the same family
examples: ▪ His sons have worked in the family business for years.

children.name: the most important office of an organization or company, or the people working there
examples: _Paul was transferred to our head office in London.
_Head office have asked for a report.

children.name: office
examples: văn phòng
[ C ] a part of a company
_They've got offices in Paris, London and Madrid.

children.name: branch
children.definition: a shop, office, or bank in a particular area that is part of a larger organization:
examples: chi nhánh
▪ Our store has branches all over the country.
▪ I’m sorry, we can’t change foreign currency. We’re only a small branch, you see.
branch of
▪ You can deposit money at any branch of the Northwest Pacific Bank.
branchnoun[ C ]PART chi nhánh
one of the offices or groups that form part of a large business organization
_I used to work in thelocalbranchofa large bank.
_She's a branchmanager.
_Take the forms into your local branchoffice.

children.name: warehouse
examples: ware house/ˈweəhaʊs$ˈwer-/noun[countable]
a large building for storing large quantities of goods

children.name: headquarters
examples: địa điểm từ đó kiểm soát hoạt động của một tổ chức; sở chỉ huy; cơ quan đầu não; trụ sở
the main offices of an organization such as the army, police or a business company
_The company's headquarters is/are inAmsterdam.

children.name: big business
examples: doanh nghiệp lớn; công ty lớn( có tầm ảnh hưởng lớn )
powerful andinfluential(= having a lot of influence) businesses and financialorganizations when considered as a group
_The party receives most of its financial support from big business.

children.name: corporation
children.definition: a large company that employs a lot of people, especially one that includes several smaller companies:
examples: ▪ IBM is one of the biggest corporations in the world.
▪ U.S. corporations sold nearly $6.2 billion in new stock in May -- the highest monthly volume in history.
corporationnoun[ C + sing/pl verb ]BUSINESS tập đoàn
(written abbreviationCorp.) a large company or group of companies that is controlled together as a single organization
_a multinational corporation
_the British Broadcasting Corporation
_She didn't want to work for a big corporation where everything was so impersonal.
Corp.noun[ C ]BUSINESS
written abbreviation forcorporation (BUSINESS)
Corp.the written abbreviation of ‘Corporation’ - used after the name of a large company, especially in the US:
▪ Federal Express Corp.

children.name: a very large and important business or organization
examples: _In the space of just ten years, her company has grown from one small shop to a multi-million-pound empire.

children.name: multinational
children.definition: multinational company/corporation/business a very large company that has offices or factories in many different countries:
examples: công ty đa quốc gia
▪ The recording business is now controlled by multinational corporations.
multinational[countable noun]
▪ the power of the big multinationals
multinationalnoun[ C ]công ty kinh doanh ở nhiều nước khác nhau; công ty đa quốc gia
a large and powerful company that produces and sells goods in many different countries
_Are multinationals now more powerful than governments?

children.name: Incorporated
examples: tập đoàn
used after the name of a company organized as a legalcorporation(= a group of people acting as one) especially in business
_Bishop Computer Services Incorporated
Inc.adjective[ after noun ]
abbreviation forincorporated: used in the names of US companies that are legally established
_Bishop Computer Services, Inc.

children.name: plc
children.definition: the abbreviation of ‘Public Limited Company’- used inBritainafter the name of a large company that ordinary people can buy shares in:
examples: ▪ Marks & Spencer plc

children.name: limited company
examples: a company, especially one in the UK, whose owners only have to pay part of the money they owe if the company fails financially
Ltdadjective[ after noun ]
UK written abbreviation forlimited liability company: used in the name of acompany whose owners have limited responsibility for the money that it owes
_Smith and Jones Ltd

LtdBritish /Inc. American thewrittenabbreviations of ‘Limited’ and ‘Incorporated’ - used after the name of a company to show that it is legally established and that its owners are legally responsible for only a limited amount of money if the company gets into debt:
▪ Stevenson Securities Ltd
▪ Syquest Technology Inc.

children.name: holding company
children.definition: holdingcompanynouncông ty nắmđa số cổ phần của một công ty khác; công ty khống chế
examples: a company whose main purpose is to control anothercompany or companies through owningsharesin it or them

children.name: joint-stock company
examples: a business which is owned by the group of people who havesharesin the company

children.name: listed company
children.definition: nouncông ty đã niêm yết; công ty đã tham gia thị trường chứng khoán
examples: a company whosesharescan be traded on a country's mainstock market

children.name: public company
examples: công ty bán cổ phần của mình cho dân chúng; công ty cổ phần hữu hạn
a business which is owned by many people who have boughtsharesin it

children.name: when a company operates in many different parts of the world
globalization
children.definition: when companies, especially from rich countries, employ people and trade in many different parts of the world:
examples: ▪ Globalization has brought very little real benefit to developing countries.
▪ The history of capitalism has been a history of the globalization of production.
▪ a demonstration against globalization
globalization,UK usuallyglobalisationnoun[ U ](sự)toàn cầu hoá
the increase of trade around the world, especially by large companies producing and trading goods in many different countries
_We must take advantage of the increased globalization of the commodity trading business.

children.name: globalizationalsoglobalisationBritish
children.definition: when companies from one country operate in and affect countries all over the world, for example by selling their goods there, having factories there, employing people there etc:

children.name: sự toàn cầu hóa
examples: ▪ Some see the spread of English as an international language as just another consequence of globalization.
Một số người cho rằng sự lan rộng của tiếng Anh như một ngôn ngữ quốc tế là hệ quả khác của toàn cầu hoá.
▪ Globalization often means that poorer countries become too dependent on foreign investment, with the result that their own development suffers.
Toàn cầu hoá thường có nghĩa là các nước nghèo trở nên quá phụ thuộc vào đầu tư nước ngoài, dẫn đến sự phát triển của chính họ.
▪ There were widespread anti-globalization demonstrations at the World Environmental summit yesterday, leading to the arrest of dozens of protestors.
Đã có những cuộc biểu tình chống lại toàn cầu hoá lan rộng tại Hội nghị thượng đỉnh Môi trường Thế giới ngày hôm qua, dẫn tới việc bắt giữ hàng chục người biểu tình.

children.name: globalizationalsoglobalisationBritish
children.definition: when companies and businesses operate all over the world and have factories, workers, shops etc in many different countries:

children.name: toàn cầu hoá
examples: ▪Globalization can often lead to the destruction of local customs and cultures.
Toàn cầu hoá có thể dẫn tới sự phá hoại các phong tục và văn hoá địa phương.
▪ Thanks to globalization, the burger you buy in Moscow is exactly the same as the one you buy in New York.
Nhờ vào xu hướng toàn cầu hóa, loại burger bạn mua ở Moscow giống chính xác với món đó bạn mua ở New York.
▪ Anti-globalization protesters clashed with police on the streets of Geneva today.
Những người chống toàn cầu hóa đã đụng độ với cảnh sát trên đường phố Geneva hôm nay.

children.name: corporate
examples: ▪ Ad campaigns are used to both bolster sales and improve corporate image.
▪ Fisher, 37, will be responsible for corporate planning.
▪ The company is moving its corporate headquarters from Philadelphia to New York.
corporateadjective về hoặc thuộc về liên hiệp công ty
[ before noun ]relating to a large company
_corporate finance
_a corporate merger
_corporate executives

children.name: company
examples: ▪ Company profits have more than doubled in the last four years.
▪ One of the benefits of the job is the use of a company car.
▪ A spokesman said company policy doesn’t allow comment on mergers and acquisitions.

children.name: franchisee
children.definition: nounngườinhượng / được nhượng quyền thương mại
examples: someone who is given or sold a franchise

children.name: public utility
children.definition: nouncông ty dịch vụ công cộng
examples: an organization that supplies the public with water, gas or electricity

children.name: franchisee
examples: someone who is given or sold a franchise

children.name: franchiser
examples: someone who gives or sells a franchise

children.name: a company which produces goods for sale, the goods themselves, or the company'sname or symbol
examples: _Her favouritedesignerlabel (= maker of expensive clothes) is Armani.
_Their own-label vegetarian products have been a huge success.
_The group have just signed (= arranged to record) with a newrecordlabel.

children.name: operator
examples: a company that does a particular type of business
_a tour operator

children.name: dotcom
children.definition: a company that sells its goods and services on the Internet:
examples: ▪ Many dotcoms fail in their first year of trading.

children.name: line
examples: [ C ] a company that transports people or goods
_a shipping line

children.name: start-up
children.definition: a small company that has just been started, often one concerned with computing or the Internet:
examples: ▪ She works for a small internet start-up.
start-up[adjective]
▪ start-up companies
start-upnoun[ C ]
a small business that has just been started
_Start-ups are very vulnerable in the business world.

children.name: agency
children.definition: nounORGANIZATION công ty ( kinh doanh trung gian )
examples: [ C ] a business which represents one group of people when dealing with another group
_an advertising/employment/estate/travel agency
travel agencynoun[ C ]
hãng (văn phòng) của người đại lý du lịch
a company or shop that makes travel arrangements for people
travel agency/ˈtrævəl ˌeɪdʒənsi/ [countable noun] a business that arranges travel and holidays:
Đại lý du lịch
▪ Travel agencies issue at least 80 percent of all airline tickets.
Các cơ quan du lịch phát hành ít nhất 80% tổng số vé máy bay.

children.name: outfit
examples: công ty
[ C + singular or plural verb ]informalan organization, company, team, military unit, etc
_He has recently set up his own research outfit, which has as yet no name.

children.name: house
examples: a business or organization of the stated type, especially one that produces books or designs clothes
_a publishing house : nhà xuất bản
_a fashion house
_UKa curry house (= South Asian restaurant)
software housenoun[ C ]
a company which writes and sellssoftware
publishing housenoun[ C ]nhà xuất bản
a company which publishes books

children.name: partnership
examples: [ C ] a company which is owned by two or more people
_the John Lewis Partnership

children.name: consultancy
examples: [ C ] a company that gives specialist advice on a particular subject
_a management/financial/recruitment consultancy
management consultancynoun
[ C ] a company that offers other companies advice about the best way of managing and improving their businesses

children.name: subsidiary
children.definition: a company that is owned and controlled by a larger company:
examples: công ty con
▪ Sharp Electronics is the U.S. subsidiary of Japan’s Sharp Corporation.
subsidiary company
▪ Relco plans to establish a subsidiary company in the UK with a capital of around $4m.
subsidiarynoun[ C ]công ty con
a company which is owned by a larger company

children.name: conglomerate
children.definition: a very large business organization that consists of several different companies which have joined together:
examples: công ty mẹ
▪ A vast American conglomerate has announced plans to buy the site at a cost of well over a billion dollars.
▪ In the mid-1980s the big financial conglomerates muscled into the market.
▪ The German media conglomerate Kronstadt AG reported record earnings last year.
conglomeratenounCOMPANY tập đoàn
[ C ] a company that owns several smaller businesses whose products or services are usually very different
_a financial/industrial conglomerate

children.name: parent company
children.definition: nouncông ty mẹ (công ty điều khiển nhiều công ty khác)
examples: a company which controls other smaller companies
